snippet: Mr. Hakim took over a hot-dog counter on 42nd Street from his father, but the business fell victim to the city’s revitalization efforts in Times Square in the 1990s.
abstract: Fred Hakim, owner of a family-run hot-dog counter in Times Square who was evicted in 1997 as part of the city's revitalization of the area, dies at age 83.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Hakim took over a hot-dog counter on 42nd Street from his father, but the business fell victim to the city’s revitalization efforts in Times Square in the 1990s.

headline.seo: Fred Hakim, Times Square Hot-Dog Vendor, Dies at 83
headline.main: Fred Hakim, Times Square Hot-Dog Vendor, Dies at 83
headline.print_headline: Fred Hakim, 83, Times Sq. Hot-Dog Vendor
